org.simplity.gateway

Class JsonRespWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.gateway.JsonRespWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RespWriter

    public class JsonRespWriter
extends Object
implements RespWriter
    prepares a JSON response based on output specifications. Important to note that this writer automatically starts an object so that the caller can start writing right away. It also obviously men that this root object is automatically closed when the response ends
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Method Detail

      • getFinalResponseObject

        public Object getFinalResponseObject()
        get the response text and close the writer. That is the reason this method is called getFinalResponse rather than getResponse. Side effect of closing the writer is hinted with this name
        Specified by:
        getFinalResponseObject in interface RespWriter
        Returns:
        response text.Null if nothing was written so far, or the writer was piped to another output mechanism

      • setField

        public void setField(String fieldName,
                     Object value)
        Description copied from interface: RespWriter
        write a field as attribute-value pair. Simplity deals with primitives as Value objects, and hence a specific method for this. use object() to set non-value attributes
        Specified by:
        setField in interface RespWriter

      • getCachingKey

        public String getCachingKey()
        Specified by:
        getCachingKey in interface RespWriter
        Returns:
        get the key based on which the response can be cached. emptyString means no key is used for caching. null means it can not be cached.

      • getCacheValidity

        public int getCacheValidity()
        Specified by:
        getCacheValidity in interface RespWriter
        Returns:
        number of minutes the cache is valid for. 0 means it has no expiry. This method is relevant only if getCachingKey returns non-null (indication that the service can be cached)

      • setCaching

        public void setCaching(String key,
                       int minutes)
        Specified by:
        setCaching in interface RespWriter
        Parameters:
        key - key based on which the response can be cached. emptyString means no key is used for caching. null means it can not be cached
        minutes - if non-null cache is to be invalidated after these many minutes

        Specified by:

      • hasOutputSpec

        public boolean hasOutputSpec()
        Description copied from interface: RespWriter
        is this writer based on output specification so that it can select, and format required out put data
        Specified by:
        hasOutputSpec in interface RespWriter
        Returns:
        true if it has details of output parameters. false if it is a pipe and service should take care of that

      • setAsResponse

        public void setAsResponse(Object responseObject)
        Description copied from interface: RespWriter
        use this as the response object. If used, typically this is the only call before a writeOut() call.
        Specified by:
        setAsResponse in interface RespWriter

      • moveToObject

        public Object moveToObject(String qualifiedFieldName)
        Description copied from interface: RespWriter
        make this qualified field as the target object for all setXXX commands. fields of root objects have no prefix. child filed is prefixed with parentField and a dot. for example "orders.orderDetails". This array is created if required.
        Specified by:
        moveToObject in interface RespWriter
        Returns:
        null if no object found with that field name, and it could not be created.

      • moveToArray

        public Object moveToArray(String qualifiedFieldName)
        Description copied from interface: RespWriter
        make this qualified field as the target array for all setXXX commands. fields of root objects have no prefix. child filed is prefixed with parentField and a dot. for example "orders.orderDetails". This array is created if required.
        Specified by:
        moveToArray in interface RespWriter
        Returns:
        null if no object found with that field name, and it could not be created.

      • setAsCurrentObject

        public void setAsCurrentObject(Object object)
        Description copied from interface: RespWriter
        Use this as the current object.
        Specified by:
        setAsCurrentObject in interface RespWriter
        Parameters:
        object - typically an object that was returned earlier. Advanced users can use this to build different objects all together.
